meanings.definition: The act or process of scaling or flaking off.
meanings.sent1: After the sunburn, the squamations of skin started to peel off.
meanings.sent2: The squamations of paint on the old wall were chipping away.
meanings.sent3: The squamations of snow on the roof looked like tiny falling leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter caused the squamations of tension to flake away.
meanings.sent5: The squamations of rust on the metal gate made it look ancient and worn.

meanings.definition: A scale or flake, as of horn, skin, or fish.
meanings.sent1: The squamations of the fish shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The squamations of the lizard's skin felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The squamations of the pastry crust were crispy and delicious.
meanings.sent4: The squamations of the dragon's scales were as hard as armor.
meanings.sent5: The squamations of the pine cone resembled tiny overlapping tiles.
